name: BalanceAdjustment
doc: A balance adjustment request and response events

type.name: EventMetadata
type.doc: Metadata, to be used in each event class

fields.name: eventId
fields.doc: A globally unique ID for this Kafka message

fields.name: traceToken
fields.doc: An ID that can be used to link all the requests and Kafka messages in a given transaction. If you already have a trace token from a previous event/request, you should copy it here. If this is the very start of a transaction, you should generate a fresh trace token and put it here. A UUID is suitable

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: A timestamp for when the event was created (in epoch millis)

type.name: BalanceAdjustmentRequest
type.doc: Balance Adjustment request has been sent

fields.name: jobId
fields.doc: A unique balance adjustment job id. Will correspond with the jobId of BalanceAdjustmentResponse

fields.name: accountId
fields.doc: Unique identifier for the customer. Gentrack Account ID. Usually 7 digits.

fields.name: msn
fields.doc: Meter Serial Number of the meter having its balance adjusted

fields.name: mpxn
fields.doc: A Meter Point Administration Number (Electricity) or Meter Point Reference Number (Gas). It is expected that the specified meter supplies this Supply Point.

fields.name: fuel
fields.doc: Type of fuel of the meter

fields.name: amount
fields.doc: The amount the balance was adjusted with, in thousands of a penny

fields.name: jobId
fields.doc: A unique adjustment job id. Will correspond with the jobId S2BalanceAdjustmentRequest

fields.name: status
fields.doc: The status of the balance adjustment when its completed

fields.name: balance
fields.doc: The resulting the balance after the adjustemt, in thousands of a penny
